warning:
CAUTIONARY NOTES/SPECIAL CONSIDERATIONS

 

Add TEMED last and mix gently, do not vortex.

 

Membrane must remain wet, do not let it dry.
guidelines:
Training Requirements

 

Able to accurately pipet load gel and dilute tissue samples and use Licor Odyssey Imaging Software
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data:
10 % APS

 

0.1g ammonium persulfate, dH2O to 1 ml.

 

 

Tank Buffer

            -100 ml tank buffer, dH2O to 1 L.

              Chill 4˚C

           

 

Transfer Buffer

            - 100 ml buffer                                                

            - 200 ml Methanol                             

            - 700 ml H2O

             Chill 4˚C

components.data: REAGENT PREPARATION
components.name: Section

components.data:
1.   GEL CASTING

      Wash plates well, wipe with 70% alcohol, dry. Put front glass plate with back glass plate & place in casting frame and close frame. Put rubber spacer in base of casting stand. Place casting frame with  plates in casting stand & click into place.

 

2.   10% SEPARATING GEL

      7.5 ml Acrylamide                                                     

      7.5 ml 1.5M Tris pH 8.8                    

      1.2 ml 10% SDS                                

      100 ul APS (0.1g/1 ml H2O)             

      13.66 ml H2O                                    

      40 ul TEMED (add last)                               

      Mix – don’t vortex

 

      Pour gels using ~ 6.75 mls of gel.

      Layer with 1% SDS.

      Allow to polymerize ~1 hr

      Rinse off SDS with distilled water 2x

 

3.   STACKING GEL

      2.25 ml Acrylamide                           

      3.75 ml 0.5M Tris pH 6.8                  

      0.6 ml 10% SDS                                

      50 ul APS                                           

      8.33 ml H2O                                      

      20 ul TEMED                                    

      Mix – don’t vortex

 

      Pour gel until runs over frame

      Place in the comb (no air bubbles).

      Allow to polymerize ~ 1 hr

source_data.description:
1.   GEL CASTING

      Wash plates well, wipe with 70% alcohol, dry. Put front glass plate with back glass plate & place in casting frame and close frame. Put rubber spacer in base of casting stand. Place casting frame with  plates in casting stand & click into place.

 

2.   10% SEPARATING GEL

      7.5 ml Acrylamide                                                     

      7.5 ml 1.5M Tris pH 8.8                    

      1.2 ml 10% SDS                                

      100 ul APS (0.1g/1 ml H2O)             

      13.66 ml H2O                                    

      40 ul TEMED (add last)                               

      Mix – don’t vortex

 

      Pour gels using ~ 6.75 mls of gel.

      Layer with 1% SDS.

      Allow to polymerize ~1 hr

      Rinse off SDS with distilled water 2x

 

3.   STACKING GEL

      2.25 ml Acrylamide                           

      3.75 ml 0.5M Tris pH 6.8                  

      0.6 ml 10% SDS                                

      50 ul APS                                           

      8.33 ml H2O                                      

      20 ul TEMED                                    

      Mix – don’t vortex

 

      Pour gel until runs over frame

      Place in the comb (no air bubbles).

      Allow to polymerize ~ 1 hr

components.data: GEL PREPARATION
components.name: Section

components.data:
- Typical load is 20 µg total protein

      - Typical amount loaded is 20 µl/well

 

1.   PREPARE 2X BUFFER

      950µl Laemelli Buffer with 50 µl B-mercaptoethanol

     

 

2.   SAMPLE CALCULATION and DILUTION

       - sample total protein 10 µg/µl

       - prepare diluted samples in screw cap tubes so that the tops can’t pop

         open during denaturing

       - 3 ul sample

       - 12 µl SDS (use to make up difference in volume)

       - 15 µl Laemelli Buffer (this is always half of the total volume)

 

3.   DENATURING of SAMPLES

      Boil sample in screw cap vial for 1-2 minutes then place on ice until

      ready to load. (gently boiling H2O or Dry bath set at 100°C)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
- Typical load is 20 µg total protein

      - Typical amount loaded is 20 µl/well

 

1.   PREPARE 2X BUFFER

      950µl Laemelli Buffer with 50 µl B-mercaptoethanol

     

 

2.   SAMPLE CALCULATION and DILUTION

       - sample total protein 10 µg/µl

       - prepare diluted samples in screw cap tubes so that the tops can’t pop

         open during denaturing

       - 3 ul sample

       - 12 µl SDS (use to make up difference in volume)

       - 15 µl Laemelli Buffer (this is always half of the total volume)

 

3.   DENATURING of SAMPLES

      Boil sample in screw cap vial for 1-2 minutes then place on ice until

      ready to load. (gently boiling H2O or Dry bath set at 100°C)

components.data: SAMPLE PREPARATION
components.name: Section

components.data:
1.   ASSEMBLE ELECTROPHORESIS TANK

      Assemble tank as shown in BioRad MiniProtean 3 Manual

      Pour Pre-Chilled Tank Buffer into the tank.

      Fill upper chamber and pour excess into lower chamber to ~ 2 in deep.

 

2.   LOAD SAMPLES

      Using gel loading tips, Pipet 5 µl molecular weight marker into first well then pipet samples into gel wells (20 µl/well).

      Run at 50 mAmps/gel.

      Stop when dye front reaches bottom of gel.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1.   ASSEMBLE ELECTROPHORESIS TANK

      Assemble tank as shown in BioRad MiniProtean 3 Manual

      Pour Pre-Chilled Tank Buffer into the tank.

      Fill upper chamber and pour excess into lower chamber to ~ 2 in deep.

 

2.   LOAD SAMPLES

      Using gel loading tips, Pipet 5 µl molecular weight marker into first well then pipet samples into gel wells (20 µl/well).

      Run at 50 mAmps/gel.

      Stop when dye front reaches bottom of gel.

components.data: ELECTROPHORESIS
components.name: Section

components.data:
1.   Remove gel from electrophoresis unit. Soak gel for 5 minutes in transfer buffer.

 

2.   Cut nitrocellulose membrane the size of the gel and soak for 5 minutes in transfer buffer.     

 

3.   Build sandwich in transfer cage as below (prepare in tray ½ full of transfer buffer) and roll out air bubbles.

 

Sponge

Blotter Paper 2 sheets

Gel

Membrane

Blotter Paper 2 sheets

Sponge

 

GREY CAGE ⇒

 

4.   Place cages in tank. Fill tank with transfer buffer.

 

5.   Place lid with electrodes on tank, Making sure the grey side of the cages are facing the red electrode.

 

6.   Run overnight in cold room with at 80 mAmps.

6.   Run overnight in cold room with at 80 mAmps.

components.data: TRANSFER
components.name: Section

components.data:
1.   PBS

      This reagent is made according to the directions provided by Pierce; 1 packet BupH Phosphate Buffered Saline Packs, dH2O to 500 ml

 

2.   PBS/ 0.1%Tween 20 Rinse Buffer

      2packet BupH Phosphate Buffered Saline Packs, dH2O to 1L, 1 ml Tween 20

 

3.   Wash Buffer

      1L PBS + 1ml Tween 20

 

4.   Block Solution Odyssey 927-40000

 

5.   1˚ Buffer; Block Solution/0.1%Tween 20

       100ml Block + 100µl Tween 20

 

6.   2nd Buffer: Block Solution/0.1%Tween/0.1%SDS

      30ml Block/Tween + 30µl Tween 20

components.data: SNAP ID IMMUNOBINDING REAGENT PREPARATION
components.name: Section

components.data:
1.      Wet the white suface of the blot holder with H2O

2.      Place blot in center; protein side down

3.      Remove air bubbles with roller

4.      Place spacer on blot & remove air bubbles w/roller

5.      Close & squeeze firmly

6.      Open lid & place in chamber/align tabs w/notches

7.      Close & latch lid
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1.      Wet the white suface of the blot holder with H2O

2.      Place blot in center; protein side down

3.      Remove air bubbles with roller

4.      Place spacer on blot & remove air bubbles w/roller

5.      Close & squeeze firmly

6.      Open lid & place in chamber/align tabs w/notches

7.      Close & latch lid

components.data: PRE-WET SNAP ID SYSTEM
components.name: Section

components.data:
1.      Add 30ml LiCor blocking soln, sit 5 min

2.      Apply vacuum until empty, TURN OFF vacuum
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1.      Add 30ml LiCor blocking soln, sit 5 min

2.      Apply vacuum until empty, TURN OFF vacuum

components.data: BLOCK
components.name: Section

components.data:
1.      Add 30µl 1° antibody/3ml Block+ 3ul Tween 20

2.      sit for 10 min

3.      Turn on vacuum

4.      With vacuum running wash 3X30ml in wash buffer: :PBS-0.1%Tween 20

5.      Turn vacuum off
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1.      Add 30µl 1° antibody/3ml Block+ 3ul Tween 20

2.      sit for 10 min

3.      Turn on vacuum

4.      With vacuum running wash 3X30ml in wash buffer: :PBS-0.1%Tween 20

5.      Turn vacuum off

components.data: PRIMARY ANTIBODY INCUBATION
components.name: Section

components.data:
1.      Add 2µl 2nd antibody to 3ml Block+ 3µl Tween+3µl 10%SDS

2.      *COVER from light*

3.      Sit 10 min

4.      Turn on vacuum

5.      With vacuum on wash 3X30ml in wash buffer: :PBS-0.1%Tween 20

6.      Turn OFF vacuum

7.      Remove blot

7.      Remove blot

components.data: SECONDARY ANTIBODY INCUBATION
components.name: Section

components.data:
1.      Lay the membrane on filter paper

2.      Put membrane/filter paper in black box, put in dark until dry (4 hours – over night)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1.      Lay the membrane on filter paper

2.      Put membrane/filter paper in black box, put in dark until dry (4 hours – over night)

components.data: DRY BLOT
components.name: Section

components.data:
1.   Make sure surface and glass is clean and dry

 

2.   Place membrane on LiCOR

 

3.   Place clean glass plate on top of membrane3. Select appropriate channel(s) 700, 800

 

4.   Preset on Membrane

 

5.   Select appropriate channel(s) 700, 800

 

6.   Select area to scan and start scan
